definition: feudal term of praise for ruler, king or emperor/general term for saint in former times/term for God during the Taiping Heavenly Kingdom 太平天國|太平天国/Holy Spirit (in Christian Trinity)
Whit Sunday (Christian Festival celebrating the Holy Spirit)

sentences.english: Remain within the sight and touch of the Holy Spirit, my beloved Spouse.
sentences.chinese: 请长留在圣神的目光和触感之中，祂是我心爱的净配。

sentences.english: Who also hath manifested to us your love in the spirit.
sentences.chinese: 也就是他给我们报告了圣神所赐与你们的爱。

sentences.english: It is helpful to reflect on what listening to the Holy Spirit is not.
sentences.chinese: 反省一下在哪些情况下没有聆听圣神的话语是有益的。

sentences.english: Guided by the Holy Spirit, we compiled the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 在圣神的引导下我们编定了圣经。

sentences.english: To receive the Holy Spirit is a special characteristic of the Church.
sentences.chinese: 领受圣神，也是教会的特质。

sentences.english: We need to cultivate interior dispositions in order to attract and receive the Holy Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要培育内心的性情以被圣神吸引和领受圣神。

sentences.english: We need to cultivate interior dispositions in order to attract and receive the Holy Spirit.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要培育内心的性情以被圣神吸引和领受圣神。

definition: God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
Holy Father/God the Father (in the Christian Trinity)
Holy Son/Jesus Christ/God the Son (in the Christian Trinity)
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
memorial tablet in a temple commemorating a deceased father
